name: electricity production, hydro, aluminium industry | electricity, high voltage, aluminium industry | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/22612/documentation

This is a dataset used to create an aluminium industry specific electricity market for 'aluminium production Canada".The production volume represents the total amount of hydroelectricity used in the region for aluminium production (electrolysis and ingot casting). The dataset also identifies the technology and provinces providing the hydroelectricity in the region. ;Electricity markets specific to the aluminium-industry are needed in an LCI database because primary aluminium production is very energy intensive, and hence the location of production plants is often determined by access to large amounts of cheap electricity, which often results in an electricity mix that is different from the general grid mix of the countries where the production plants are located. ;It is assumed that the production of electricity in general and in aluminium industry specific power plants is identical. Details on actual electricity generation with each technology can be found in the corresponding datasets.;The share of hydroelectricity produced by the different technologies (reservoir, run-of-river, pumped storage) is calculated using both (1) estimates of the share of hydroelectricity coming from each province for Canada that is used for aluminium production and (2) the ecoinvent v3 split of hydroelectricity technologies for these same geographies. The province-level aluminium production is supplied directly by the Canadian Aluminium Association (personal communication).;Calculations are detailed in the report 'Calculating grid mixes for the aluminium industry in ecoinvent v3', available on the ecoinvent website.;;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:; - electricity production, hydro, aluminium industry, RNA, 2015 - 2015 (c352244d-ed75-5372-9631-6d9ea2e774e1)]

Re-labelling dataset, not representing a real transformation activity. Conceptually, the activity can be said to start with the production of electricity.

Re-labelling dataset, not representing a real transformation activity. Conceptually, the activity can be said to end with a given amount of high voltage electricity labelled as specifically used for the production of electricity.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Production volume updated with 2016 data from AAC
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: For the split of hydroelectricity production to the respective technologies (reservoir, run-of-river, pumped storage), shares of different types of hydroelectric plants from each province for Canada used as a proxy for the split relevant for the aluminium industry, see general comments.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: IAI and AAC data used for total electricity used in the production of aluminium that is from hydro power plants and to split between respective technologies (reservoir, run-of-river, pumped storage). Data based on 100% of regional aluminium production.

exchanges.description: Expressed as sum of contributing technologies (inputs) to allow uncertainty analysis: each technology share is uncertain, and in a Monte Carlo analysis will always be normalized by the sum contribution of each technology
